name: Witcher 3 HUD
description: A reimagination of the way The Witcher 3 Stamina Bar is placed for the sake of gameplay comfort and quick understanding of the current state Geralt abilities are in.
roles: UX research, UI Design & Motion Animation

block_paragraphs.paragraph: The stamina bar, due to its positioning, is uncomfortable to look at because it is too far from the center of the screen, where the character and enemies are located.
This becomes a problem because it requires the player to constantly take their eyes off the combat, resulting not in dynamic gameplay, but rather in an annoyance.
Looking at the industry of Action RPG and exploring games we found some solutions to those problematics that would fit perfect into The Witcher 3.
In one hand we have games like Skyrim or Elden Ring, using a compass for navigating the world, a function even requested by the fans.
And for managing the stamina one of the best examples is Zelda with the Stamina Wheel and others games with resources management inside the sight.

content_blocks.title: Using what we know to solve the issue

block_paragraphs.paragraph: The solution provided consisted in turning the stamina bar into a dynamic wheel that follows Geraldt body during combat.
For the navigation, the map was hidden and a compass was implemented and adapted.
The first version of the Prototypes delivered a new bar, but the job was unfinished.
While the main thesis was completed, the problem persisted, therefore it demanded a more complete translation of the UI.
The solution provided consisted in turning the stamina bar into a dynamic wheel that follows Geraldt body during combat.

conclusion.paragraph: Me paro sobre los hombros de gigantes que admiro al plantear el rediseño de la experiencia de usuario de este videojuego.
Sin embargo, siempre hay cabida a la mejora y al final del día de esto se trata. Estas propuestas buscan hacer aún mejor una experiencia de por si ya es extraordinaria.
